availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles J. McConnell (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret E. Blakely McConnell in Hopkinsville, Kentucky, on January 20, 1845. Father of Lorenzo McConnell, Virginia E. McConnell, Sarah E. McConnell, Thomas L. McConnell, and Boyd McConnell. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1840. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, p. 43.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 362B-363A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 786.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Burnesville, p. 21.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Burnesville, p. 208B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film #001942963, p. 82.
